word: they will come to their senses
parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To become sober again, recover sound sense. From ana and nepho; to become sober again, i.e. regain senses.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From pegnumi; a trap; figuratively, a trick or statagem.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From diaballo; a traducer; specially, Satan.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To capture alive, capture for life, enthrall. From the same as zoon and agreuo; to take alive, i.e. to capture or ensnare.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
An act of will, will; plur: wishes, desires. From the prolonged form of ethelo; a determination, i.e. choice or inclination.
